identified-content.org: Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center

abstract.p: Norma Hurlburt is named director of Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center; Jacqueline M Taylor is resigning (S)

block.p: Norma Hurlburt, the former executive vice president of the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra, has been appointed executive director of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, the society's board has announced.

Ms. Hurlburt will assume the post on July 5, replacing Jacqueline M. Taylor, who is resigning, effective June 30. Ms. Hurlburt left the Orpheus ensemble, a conductorless orchestra, in 1998 and has since worked on special projects with chamber musicians and organizations. She has also arranged concerts for chamber ensembles and managed such artists as the mezzo-soprano Jan DeGaetani and her pianist, Gilbert Kalish.

Norma Hurlburt, the former executive vice president of the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra, has been appointed executive director of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, the society's board has announced.

Ms. Hurlburt will assume the post on July 5, replacing Jacqueline M. Taylor, who is resigning, effective June 30. Ms. Hurlburt left the Orpheus ensemble, a conductorless orchestra, in 1998 and has since worked on special projects with chamber musicians and organizations. She has also arranged concerts for chamber ensembles and managed such artists as the mezzo-soprano Jan DeGaetani and her pianist, Gilbert Kalish.
Ms. Taylor, who has served as executive director since July 1994, plans to pursue graduate studies at the Gallatin School at New York University, where she is already enrolled.
